place.name: STACKPOLE ELIDIR
place.gazetteerText: STACKPOLE-ELIDOR, a parish in the district and county of Pembroke; on the coast, 4 miles S by E of Pembroke r. station. Post town, Pembroke. Acres, 2,845. Real property, £2,480. Pop., 273. Houses, 46. The manor, with S. Court, belongs to Earl Cawdor. S. Court was rebuilt by Campbell of Cawdor; and occupies the site of an old castle, which stood a siege in the time of Cromwell. The living is a rectory, united with St. Petrox, in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £350.* Patron, Earl Cawdor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
